title: Leslie R Walker-Harding, MD
description: Leslie R Walker-Harding, MD, Senior Vice President and Chief Academic Officer; Department of Pediatrics Chair
cleaned_text: Leslie R Walker-Harding, MD On staff since February 2019 Children's Title: Senior Vice President and Chief Academic Officer; Department of Pediatrics Chair Research Center: [Center for Child Health, Behavior and Development](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/research/centers-programs/child-health-behavior-and-development/) - Dr. Leslie Walker-Harding is the Ford/Morgan Endowed Professor and Chair of the Department of Pediatrics as well as Associate Dean for the University of Washington. She is also the Chief Academic Officer and Senior Vice President for Seattle Children's Hospital. She has been dedicated to the health and wellbeing of children and adolescents for over 25 years, particularly in the area of prevention of adolescent substance use and promotion of healthy adolescent development. Her current focus is to raise awareness of and bring to national scale, proven interventions to prevent the development of substance use and mental health conditions in children and adolescents. In this effort she is Co-Chair of the Forum for Children's Well Being: Promoting Cognitive, Affective, and Behavioral Health for Children and Youth in the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine. - Overview - Board Certification(s) - Adolescent Medicine Pediatrics - Medical/Professional School - University of Illinois College of Medicine at Rockford, Rockford, IL - Residency - University of Chicago Comer Children's Hospital GM, Chicago, IL - Fellowship - University of CA at San Francisco Adolescent Med, San Francisco, CA - Research Focus Area - Chronic Conditions / Special Health Care Needs, Health Promotion and Disease Prevention, Behavioral / Mental Health
